{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to Piaget's theory of cognitive development, the pre-operational stage is the second stage of cognitive development. This stage is characterized by the child's ability to engage in symbolic play and manipulate symbols, but they still have difficulty seeing things from different points of view. According to multiple documents, including Document [0], Document [1], Document [3], and Document [26], the pre-operational stage occurs from roughly 2 to 7 years of age.", "answer_choice": "C. 2-6 years."}
